industriesForeign.pageSubtitle: Seamless Cross-Trade Logistics Between Any Two Countries Worldwide
industriesForeign.overviewText1: World Trans & Logistics specializes in managing shipments between two countries without the cargo ever passing through Senegal. Our foreign-to-foreign freight service, also known as cross-trade logistics, enables businesses to move goods seamlessly between any origin and destination worldwide, leveraging our extensive global network of agents and partners across more than 50 countries.
industriesForeign.overviewText2: Whether you need to ship manufactured goods from China to Brazil, raw materials from Australia to Germany, or consumer products from India to the United States, WTL coordinates every detail from our operations center in Dakar. Our multilingual team handles documentation, customs compliance, carrier selection, and real-time tracking so you can focus on growing your business.
industriesForeign.overviewText3: As a third-party logistics provider with deep expertise in international trade, we understand the complexities of cross-border commerce including varying customs regulations, trade agreements, documentation requirements, and transit considerations that differ from corridor to corridor.
industriesForeign.overviewImageAlt: Global freight operations at a busy international port
industriesForeign.benefitsSubtitle: Discover why leading businesses trust World Trans & Logistics to manage their foreign-to-foreign shipments with precision and reliability.
industriesForeign.benefit1Text: Our established partnerships with carriers, freight forwarders, and customs brokers in over 50 countries ensure your cargo moves efficiently through any trade lane. We have vetted agents in every major port and airport worldwide, giving you access to competitive rates and reliable service no matter the route.
industriesForeign.benefit2Text: Eliminate the complexity of coordinating between multiple providers in different time zones. Your dedicated WTL account manager serves as the single point of contact for the entire shipment lifecycle, from booking through delivery, providing consolidated reporting and proactive communication at every stage.
industriesForeign.benefit3Text: Benefit from our consolidated buying power and deep market knowledge to secure the most competitive freight rates. We analyze multiple routing options, carrier choices, and transit times to find the optimal balance between cost and service for every shipment, potentially saving you 15-30% compared to direct booking.
industriesForeign.benefit4Text: Navigate the complex web of international trade regulations with confidence. Our compliance team stays current on export controls, import restrictions, trade sanctions, and documentation requirements for every country pair, ensuring your shipments clear customs smoothly and avoid costly delays or penalties.
industriesForeign.processSubtitle: A streamlined process designed to simplify even the most complex cross-trade shipments.
industriesForeign.step1Text: We begin with a thorough assessment of your shipping requirements. Our team reviews the origin and destination countries, cargo specifications, timeline, budget, and any special handling needs. We then propose the optimal routing, carrier selection, and service level to meet your objectives.
industriesForeign.step2Text: Our documentation specialists prepare all required shipping documents including commercial invoices, packing lists, bills of lading, certificates of origin, and any country-specific permits or licenses. We book cargo space with our preferred carriers and confirm the shipment schedule with all parties.
industriesForeign.step3Text: Our agent at the origin country manages cargo pickup, inspection, packaging verification, and export customs clearance. We ensure the goods are properly loaded and all export documentation is filed accurately and on time to prevent any departure delays.
industriesForeign.step4Text: Throughout the journey, our operations center tracks your shipment in real-time using advanced tracking systems. We monitor vessel or flight schedules, port congestion, weather conditions, and any potential disruptions, providing you with regular status updates and proactively managing exceptions.
industriesForeign.step5Text: At the destination, our local agent handles import customs clearance, duty payment, inspections, and final delivery to the consignee. We coordinate last-mile transport and ensure all import regulations are met, completing the shipment cycle with full documentation and proof of delivery.
industriesForeign.step6Text: Our service extends beyond delivery. We provide complete shipment files, cost reconciliation, performance analytics, and any required post-delivery documentation. Our team remains available to address warranty claims, returns logistics, or any other follow-up needs.
industriesForeign.ctaTitle: Ready to Streamline Your Global Supply Chain?
industriesForeign.ctaText: Let WTL manage your foreign-to-foreign freight with the expertise and global reach your business demands. Request a free consultation and competitive quote today.

industriesExport.pageSubtitle: Helping Businesses Export from Senegal & West Africa to Global Markets
industriesExport.overviewText1: World Trans & Logistics provides comprehensive export services designed to help businesses in Senegal and across West Africa reach international markets efficiently and competitively. From agricultural commodities and seafood to mining products and manufactured goods, we have the expertise to handle every type of export cargo.
industriesExport.overviewText2: Our export division manages the entire process from factory or warehouse door to the buyer's destination. We handle export documentation, customs declarations, phytosanitary and quality certificates, packaging and containerization, freight booking on ocean and air carriers, cargo insurance, and compliance with both Senegalese export regulations and destination country import requirements.
industriesExport.overviewText3: With decades of experience navigating the trade corridors between West Africa and the world, WTL understands the unique challenges exporters face in this region, including port congestion at the Port of Dakar, seasonal shipping capacity constraints, and complex multi-country documentation requirements for goods transiting through neighboring landlocked countries.
industriesExport.overviewImageAlt: Cargo ship ready for international export voyages
industriesExport.processSubtitle: A proven workflow that ensures your exports move smoothly from origin to destination.
industriesExport.step1Text: We assess your product, target market, and shipping requirements. Our trade advisors review applicable regulations, tariff classifications, and any preferential trade agreements that could reduce duties at the destination, such as the AfCFTA, EU-ACP Economic Partnership Agreements, or AGOA for US-bound goods.
industriesExport.step2Text: Our documentation team prepares the complete export file: commercial invoices, packing lists, certificates of origin, bills of lading or air waybills, phytosanitary certificates (for agricultural products), ECOWAS trade certificates, EUR.1 movement certificates for EU markets, and any other product-specific documentation required.
industriesExport.step3Text: We ensure your goods are properly packaged and loaded to withstand international transit. Our team manages container stuffing, palletization, shrink-wrapping, fumigation (where required), and weight verification. We optimize container utilization to minimize shipping costs per unit.
industriesExport.step4Text: Our licensed customs brokers file export declarations with Senegalese Customs (Direction Generale des Douanes), manage pre-shipment inspections, coordinate with COTECNA or other verification agencies, and ensure full compliance with all export regulations including any restricted goods procedures.
industriesExport.step5Text: We select the optimal carrier and route based on your timeline and budget. Our strong relationships with major shipping lines (MSC, Maersk, CMA CGM) and airlines ensure competitive rates and priority space allocation. We manage port handling, terminal charges, and vessel loading at the Port of Dakar.
industriesExport.step6Text: We arrange comprehensive marine cargo insurance to protect your goods against loss, damage, and delays during transit. Our insurance solutions cover all-risk policies, specific named perils, and war and strikes clauses tailored to your cargo value and route risk profile.
industriesExport.marketsSubtitle: WTL facilitates exports from Senegal and West Africa to major markets across every continent.
industriesExport.market1Text: France, Spain, Italy, Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, and the United Kingdom are among our most active export destinations. We leverage EU-ACP trade agreements and established shipping routes to ensure fast, cost-effective delivery. Key export products include seafood, agricultural commodities, phosphates, and textiles.
industriesExport.market2Text: China, India, Vietnam, South Korea, and Japan represent growing markets for West African exports. We manage the longer transit times and more complex documentation requirements for Asian trade lanes, specializing in bulk commodity exports such as minerals, cashew nuts, and raw materials.
industriesExport.market3Text: The United States, Brazil, Canada, and other American markets offer significant opportunities for Senegalese exporters. We navigate AGOA eligibility requirements, FDA and USDA compliance for food products, and CBP documentation standards to ensure smooth entry into North and South American ports.
industriesExport.market4Text: Intra-African trade under the AfCFTA and exports to the Middle East (UAE, Saudi Arabia, Turkey) are rapidly expanding. WTL leverages our regional network to facilitate cross-border trade within ECOWAS and beyond, managing the unique challenges of overland transport, border crossings, and regional customs unions.
industriesExport.ctaTitle: Ready to Export Your Products to the World?
industriesExport.ctaText: WTL has the experience, network, and regulatory knowledge to make your export operations seamless. Contact us today for a customized export solution and competitive freight quote.

industriesImport.pageSubtitle: Reliable Import Solutions into Senegal & West Africa
industriesImport.overviewTitle: Bringing the World to West Africa
industriesImport.overviewText1: World Trans & Logistics offers end-to-end import services for businesses bringing goods into Senegal and the broader West African market. Whether you are importing machinery, consumer electronics, construction materials, vehicles, food products, or industrial supplies, our team manages every aspect of the import chain from the supplier's door to your warehouse.
industriesImport.overviewText2: Importing into Senegal involves navigating a complex regulatory environment including GAINDE customs clearance systems, pre-shipment inspection requirements, COSEC (Conseil Senegalais des Chargeurs) declarations, and compliance with standards set by the Association Senegalaise de Normalisation (ASN). Our licensed customs brokers have decades of experience clearing goods through the Port of Dakar and Blaise Diagne International Airport.
industriesImport.overviewText3: We also manage transit cargo destined for landlocked countries in the region, including Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger, handling the additional documentation, bond guarantees, and corridor management required for goods passing through Senegalese territory en route to their final destination.
industriesImport.overviewImageAlt: Import cargo operations at the Port of Dakar
industriesImport.processTitle: Import Process from Start to Finish
industriesImport.processSubtitle: A systematic approach that minimizes delays and ensures full regulatory compliance.
industriesImport.step1Text: Before your goods are even shipped, we review the product classification (HS codes), calculate estimated duties and taxes, verify import permit requirements, and advise on the most cost-effective shipping method. Early planning prevents costly surprises at the border and ensures you budget accurately for landed costs.
industriesImport.step2Text: We liaise with your overseas suppliers to ensure shipping documents are prepared correctly before departure. This includes verifying commercial invoices match the purchase order, confirming packing lists are accurate, ensuring certificates of origin are properly issued, and coordinating container loading and booking with the nominated carrier.
industriesImport.step3Text: From the moment your cargo departs the origin port or airport, we monitor its progress in real time. Our tracking systems provide visibility on vessel positions, estimated arrival times, transshipment status, and any potential delays. We keep you informed with regular updates so you can plan your receiving operations accordingly.
industriesImport.step4Text: Our experienced customs brokers prepare and file all import declarations through the GAINDE system. We handle duty and tax calculations, manage pre-shipment inspection (BSC/BESC) certificates, coordinate with scanning and inspection authorities, and resolve any queries or holds from customs officials efficiently to minimize demurrage and storage charges.
industriesImport.step5Text: We manage the calculation and payment of all applicable duties, taxes, and fees including customs duties, VAT (TVA), statistical fees, COSEC charges, and any product-specific levies. Our team optimizes duty payments by leveraging applicable trade agreements, temporary admission regimes, and duty exemption programs where your business qualifies.
industriesImport.step6Text: Once your goods are released from customs, we manage port drayage, container devanning, warehousing if needed, and final delivery to your premises anywhere in Senegal or the region. Our fleet and transport partners ensure safe, timely delivery with proper handling equipment for heavy, oversized, or sensitive cargo.
industriesImport.complianceSubtitle: Navigating Senegal's import regulations requires specialized knowledge. Here is what you need to know.
industriesImport.compliance1Text: Most imports into Senegal require a Bordereau de Suivi des Cargaisons (BSC/BESC) issued by COSEC. This cargo tracking document must be obtained before shipment and presented during customs clearance. WTL handles the entire BSC application process on your behalf to prevent arrival delays.
industriesImport.compliance2Text: Senegal applies the West African Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU/UEMOA) Common External Tariff with four duty bands: 0%, 5%, 10%, and 20% depending on product category. Additional levies include a 1% statistical fee, 1% community solidarity levy, and 0.5% ECOWAS levy. We ensure accurate classification to avoid overpayment.
industriesImport.compliance3Text: Certain products require specific import permits or compliance certificates. Food products need sanitary clearance, pharmaceuticals require Ministry of Health authorization, electronics must meet safety standards, and vehicles are subject to age restrictions. WTL guides you through every requirement before you ship.
industriesImport.compliance4Text: Senegal offers various duty exemption programs for investment projects (Code des Investissements), mining operations, diplomatic imports, NGO equipment, and goods destined for special economic zones. Our customs team identifies and applies for all applicable exemptions to reduce your import costs legally.
industriesImport.ctaTitle: Need to Import Goods into Senegal?
industriesImport.ctaText: From customs clearance to last-mile delivery, WTL handles every step of your import process. Get a free duty estimate and import plan from our specialists today.
